nodes.text: Dobbis was a goddess of the Gungan religion. She was one of the most important divinities of nature, and she was associated with rain. According to the legends, the goddess' actions were supervised by Oma-Oma, the chief divinity, and she lived with the rest of the gods in the beautiful underwater city of Ossorus. One of the gigantic stone head left by the long-vanished Elders was interpreted by the Gungans as a representation of Dobbis, and the famous Jar Jar Binks was known to have spent several afternoons sleeping next to that statue.

Dobbis was first mentioned in the 2000 novel Pirates from Beyond the Sea, the eleventh installment of Star Wars Episode I Adventures. Details about the goddess were contained in the French edition of the 2001 video game Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds, in the database entry pertaining to the Gungan society. This detail did not feature in the English version of the entry. Several other deities, namely Balam, Balmtop, Mekamok, Gobba, Nododo, Kobble and Wamka Pol are also exclusive to the French version of the database. Though most of these names were not used in any other source, Nododo was set to appear in The Essential Guide to Episode I, a cancelled reference book.
